showScoreExcerpt:
sophisticated musically, intensely acted and gorgeously sung, with a grand 17-piece orchestra and a large splendid cast. Certainly, a story involving antisemitism is timely. But “Parade,” despite the revisions, also feels undermined by some of the same problems identified in the initial production. Didactic, obvious and overly clever, it’s disturbing in ways it doesn’t intend.
